gui

Class AppConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.AppConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class AppConfig
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Class that creates a frame with some tabs to let the user choose if he wants to import, export, manually add, manually edit or either get listings and statistics.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppConfig()
      Constructor of this class it calls its superclass constructor to set the title, it also calls all the necessary methods in this class in order to initialize the panels when an object of this class is created.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppConfig

        public AppConfig()
        Constructor of this class it calls its superclass constructor to set the title, it also calls all the necessary methods in this class in order to initialize the panels when an object of this class is created. Sets properties.
        See Also:
        addPaineis(), addTabs(), addImports(), addExports(), addEdits(), addList(), setProperties(int,int,int,boolean)

    • Method Detail

      • setProperties

        private void setProperties(int w,
                 int h,
                 int opcao,
                 boolean visible)
        Sets the properties to this frame such as /size, visibility and the operation that will happen by default when the user initiates a "close" on this frame.
        Parameters:
        w - the desired width to the window
        h - the desired height to the window
        opcao - parameter to use when calling javax.swing.JFrame#setDefaultCloseOperation(int)
        visible - sets the windows to visible if the parameter is true
        See Also:
        Window.setSize(int,int), JFrame.setDefaultCloseOperation(int), Window.setVisible(boolean)

      • configButtons

        private void configButtons(Botao[] botoes)

        botoes - vector of Botao

      • addList

        private void addList()
        Has the purpose to create a minimalistic menu, adding a title and programmed buttons to the list panel. This method is meticulous about the way tabs behave trying to give the user a smooth navigation between tabs. It uses the method isReady() in order to aproach a safer implementation of the method.
